@davemh72 @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @Cap_it_off Did anyone think the odour is from coal board, @ClareDinnisEA how,any of the 10,000 odour complaints you received last month were from @RedIndustries2 complaining about hydrogen sulphide gases coming onto their site, what dates & times, they must be concerned about their workers.

@Independent @StinkStopthe @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL @PHE_uk You really need to investigate this and find out the truth, its something never experienced at this level, we will never find out what is buried but we suspect gypsum with household waste that was banned in 2014, our cries for help were ignored that it was not the normal!

tweets.text: @Tus_M_ @StinkStopthe @ErinBrockovich I'm interested in who let RED dump so much more stuff at Walleys? As a resident (Westlands), I can't remember any smells before 2019. Who signed it off? Staffordshire CC, the EA, both? Surely they are as culpable as Red for this. We're being failed by multiple parties here.

Here is a good statement reflecting our concerns with regard to HS2 Tunnelling and the impact on the chalk aquifer https://t.co/tUIdNMbtSW
It is with sadness we announce a very compliant @EnvAgency have approved the tunnelling without any public consultation.

Starting the day with a brilliant update from @EnvAgencySW @DCfieldteamsEA . New raingauge site at Britton Fleming to improve the flood warning service locally

A low impact project with FSC timber, no concrete and solar power. Dry today but might get tested by the rains soon! https://t.co/KxUHDIflys
